intro: Flaveria robusta, commonly known as the robust ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that grows up to 2 meters tall, characterized by its sturdy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Flaveria robusta is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species adapted to dry conditions. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and potential use in restoration projects.
